title: What are some brief arguments for preference utilitarianism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Preference utilitarianism is synonymous with preference consequentialism. Presumption Morality is not objectifiable. Outline i) Three nobel conditionals ii) Consequentialism  i.a) Suffering exists i.b) Unnecessary physical suffering (pain) is bad i.c) When possible suffering ought to be avoided, lessened or eliminated ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ii.a) There are infinite different uses for one's time, and there are productive* uses for one's time ii.b) Productivity, save for one's humanity, is (generally) good ii.c) One should make productive use of their time ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ii.aa) There are people in well off circumstances, and those with very bad circumstances (between relative standards of living--generally) ii.bb) If it is possible for those in well off circumstances to help those who do not, it is good--if done effectively ii.cc) Out of intrinsic moral duty one should help (but not by intention alone) A morally justifiable preference is to lessen extreme poverty *"Productivity" can be interchangeable with different words, such as efficient.
